definition: to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗

variant of 合[he2]

sentences.english: The students must be enjoying the speech, because they're laughing their heads off.
sentences.chinese: 学生们笑得前仰后合，他们一定是很欣赏这个演讲。

sentences.english: The performance of the clown kept the public rolling about.
sentences.chinese: 小丑的表演使观众笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: Hearing the joke, she keeled over with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 听了这个笑话，她笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: This comedy has had them rolling in the aisles for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这出喜剧让观众们连续两个星期乐得前仰后合。

sentences.english: The comedian had the audience folding up .
sentences.chinese: 那个喜剧演员逗得观众笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: This comedy has had them rolling in the aisles.
sentences.chinese: 这出喜剧让他们乐的前仰后合。

sentences.english: The funny joke made the children burst their sides with laughing.
sentences.chinese: 这一笑语如此滑稽，以至于使孩子们笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: This slip of their mother's convulsed Ada and Kitty.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的口误使艾达和吉蒂笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: He keeled over with laughter when I told him the joke.
sentences.chinese: 我把笑话讲给他听时，他笑得前仰后合。

sentences.english: His joke had us convulsed with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑话逗得我们前仰后合地大笑起来。

definition: to rock one's body backward and forward/to be convulsed (with laughter etc)
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
chuckle
unable to conceal one's happiness, amazement, shock etc/grinning from ear to ear/mouth agape/gobsmacked
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to amuse/to cause to smile/amusing
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to laugh heartily/a belly laugh
